Header.title: Welcome to ARIS
Header.paragraph: Save your pets, your family, and yourself, act in time to fight against Rabies.

About.paragraph1: Vaccination has undeniably been very beneficial in promoting a healthy global population. In terms of computational approaches, immunoinformatics systems such as ARIS have paved the way for a better understanding of the rabies virus. This could be a significant step forward in addressing a critical global health challenge per population.
About.paragraph: A.R.I.S (Anti-Rabies Immunoinformatics System) is a system that aims to provide anti-rabies immunization services to animal bite centers and other facilities that are legible to administer anti rabies vaccines in Taguig City. As a result, the system is solely capable of monitoring anti-rabies vaccines.

Services.name: Wash the wound immediately
Services.text: Wash the wound with soap or detergent as soon as possible under running tap water for at least 10 minutes.

Services.name: Dry the wound
Services.text: After thorough washing, pat the wound dry with a clean cloth.

Services.name: Apply disinfectant
Services.text: Apply disinfectant - e.g. povidone iodine, spirit, etc. - after thoroughly washing and drying the wound.

Services.name: Don't apply irritants
Services.text: Irritants, such as bleach, Chilli, soil, oils, turmeric, lime, salt, and plant juice are just a few examples that should not be applied on the wounds.

Services.name: Avoid touching the wound with bare hands
Services.text: Don't touch the wound with bare hands.

Services.name: Postpone suturing if possible
Services.text: If suturing is at all necessary, it should be performed after cleaning and infiltrating RIG at the depth of wound and only minimum number of loose suture should be applied.

Services.name: Don't cauterize
Services.text: Don't burn the skin or flesh of (a wound) using a heated instrument or caustic chemical in order to stop bleeding or to prevent infection.

Services.name: Watch for signs of infection
Services.text: Seek help if you suspect infection or possible exposure to rabies, or if the wound is severe

Testimonials.name: Rabies is a virus-borne disease that is spread from animals to humans. There are two types of rabies symptoms: frantic and paralytic. The most common form of human rabies is frantic rabies.

The rabies virus invades the nervous system of mammals. It is primarily transmitted from the rabid animal's saliva when it bites or scratches someone. Licks to wounds or grazed and broken skin, or to the lining of the mouth and nose, can also transmit the disease.

Testimonials.text: How does rabies develop in humans?
Testimonials.name: The rabies virus enters the human body via the innermost layer of tissue called subcutaneous tissue. It migrates along nerves to the spinal cord and brain at an estimated speed of 12-24 mm a day. The incubation period for a person infected with rabies can be as long as 1 year.

Testimonials.text: What are the signs and symptoms of rabies?
Testimonials.name: The first symptoms of rabies are similar to those of the flu such as general weakness or discomfort, fever, and headache. As the rabies virus incubates inside the body, the person may experience an itching sensation around the bite area. Patients will later experience delirium, abnormal behavior, hydrophobia, and insomnia.

Testimonials.text: What are the symptoms of rabies in a dog or animal?
Testimonials.name: Dogs infected with the rabies virus develop the following symptoms:. Restlessness, Incoordination and paralysis, Lethargy, Hoarse barking or inability to do so, Hyper salivation and excessive salivation.

Testimonials.text: What is the earliest age at which my dog can be vaccinated?
Testimonials.name: Every rabies vaccine has specific recommendations regarding which animals it is prepared for and when an animal should be vaccinated. In dog rabies endemic countries where vaccination is by annual mass vaccination campaigns, all dogs including those less than 3 months old should be vaccinated.
Because rabies kills. Every year, an estimated 59,000 people die of one of the oldest and most terrifying diseases known to man which is rabies virus.

Contact.address: Km 14. East Service Road, Western Bicutan, 1630, Taguig City

Features.title: Vaccination Tracker
Features.text: It enables you to track your vaccination status from time to time.

Features.title: Appointment System
Features.text: It enables you to set an appointment ahead of time for future.

Features.title: Nearby Treatment Centers
Features.text: It enables you to see the nearby Treatment Centers on your location.

Features.title: Real-time Statistics
Features.text: It enables you to see rabies-related statistical reports.
